org.activebpel.rt.bpel.def.validation
Class AeLinkCycleVisitor

java.lang.Object
  org.activebpel.rt.bpel.def.visitors.AeAbstractDefVisitor
      org.activebpel.rt.bpel.def.validation.AeLinkCycleVisitor
All Implemented Interfaces:
IAeDefVisitor
public class AeLinkCycleVisitor
extends AeAbstractDefVisitor

Locates links that participate in control cycles. WS-BPEL changed the way links leaving an isolated scope behave. These links will not fire their notification until the entire isolated scope completes. This introduces another check for a control cycle since any outbound link crossing an isolated scope must not link to a graph that contains a link back into the scope. This creates a cycle since the isolated scope will not fire its links until it completes - but it can't complete until it fires its links.

traverse

protected void traverse(AeBaseDef aDef)
Overrides method for two reasons:
  1. short-circuit traversal if we reach the source activity, and
  2. call traverseActivity(AeActivityDef) to traverse activities.

Overrides:
traverse in class AeAbstractDefVisitor
Parameters:
aDef -

protected void traverseActivity(AeActivityDef aActivityDef)

Parameters:
aActivityDef -

crossesBackIntoIsolatedScope

protected boolean crossesBackIntoIsolatedScope(AeActivityDef aActivityDef)
Returns true if the activity passed in is nested within the isolated scope recorded when the link was first traversed. This represents a case where a link crosses an isolated scope and then eventually comes back in through some other activity. This creates a cycle since the isolated scope will not fire its links until it completes - but it can't complete until it fires its links.

Parameters:
aActivityDef -

traverseNextSequenceActivity

protected void traverseNextSequenceActivity(AeActivityDef aActivityDef)
Traverses the activity that follows the activity in a sequence, if any.

Parameters:
aActivityDef -
